greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of strict Golomb partitions of n.
comment: We define a Golomb partition of n to be an integer partition of n such that every ordered pair of distinct parts has a different difference.
Also the number of strict integer partitions of n such that every orderless pair of (not necessarily distinct) parts has a different sum.
link: Fausto A. C. Cariboni, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..500
example: The a(2) = 1 through a(11) = 11 partitions (A = 10, B = 11):
xref: The integer partition case is A325858.
The strict integer partition case is A325876.
Heinz numbers of the counterexamples are given by A325992.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jun 02 2019
